comments.body: Dude your glow lichen made it into the game
I think this is an excellent idea, I too had a similar thought when I was using a bundle.

I had this thought as well while playing. Just seemed really intuitive to me!

The right click hold idea sounds cool as well, although I'll be happy even if we just get the scroll function. Would make this already amazing addition to inventory management even more helpful.

I've been playing with a mod based on this idea. Bundles are way more useful when we can just take out what we need.

This saves so much time and frustration instead of having to do the inventory shuffle or dumping the whole bundle out on the ground.
i think that this was going to be added anyway
Glowberries look fragile, maybe they should have a chance to break as you climb them!
It would make sense as tridents can break through dripstone, but I would have Glowing Drowned spawn as they are in a cave
Drowned actually glow on Bedrock Edition.
Why drowned tho? It would make sense if it was in water. Maybe if it was a dripstone cave with a local water level?
Mostly to show players that tridents can be used to break dripstones. Also I agree that drowned should only spawn in water in dripstone caves.
They could also maybe spawn in water caves to add a bit more difficulty. But not too much though, because it's already difficult to not drown in there.
Wouldn't this be applicable to all metal armors?
This actually makes sense! Chainmail real life protects you from bolts of electricity while regular iron armor doesn't.
metal is very conductive so why would wearing this be beneficial?. it would just attract lightning more and zap your soul to the nether and back.

While, technically, any metal armor should work as a Faraday cage, giving that ability only to chainmail would give players a reason to use it. It would come in handy when searching for skeleton traps.
Devin Baron  Chain mail in real life actually protects you from electricity versus regular metaled armor which would shock you.

383465765852

cool. I didn't know metal worked like that
This is very wordie.  But I like the consept.  Copper should have some redstone use.  Like the lightning rod.  If it is struck. it gives off a redstone signal.

This idea seems like it takes away from the idea of redstone to much, but i like where you are going. Maybe a copper wire of some sorts that is basically redstone dust that you craft from 2 copper ingots and a redstone dust to get 4. It would function the exact same way as redstone dust but it could run on the sides and bottoms of walls.

I don't think copper should replace redstone but I do think it should have a redstone use. Copper is known to be a highly conductive material, so I thought a copper converter/reactor that would take a redstone input on one side then output it at double on the other side in 0 ticks.
I feel that one should place copper on the wall and that it should also conduct redstone. That would be a good way to lead redstone far up.
i personaly think that it should be black smiths that trade copper

404526196832 don't know what you mean by Blacksmith, there isn't a blacksmith type villager, there is Weaponsmiths, Toolsmiths and Fletchers if one of them was what you meant? But you cannot make any of those tools or weapons with copper.
i meant weaponsmith sorry
There's a typo in the title, it should be spelled geyser not gizer. Great idea btw.
What makes Strays dangerous is that the slowness affect makes it more difficult to get away from their arrows. I wouldn't remove the slowness arrows, but adding the frost effect would be a nice touch
But freezing is a lot more powerful than slowness.

I love it! Every once in a while their eyes could light up red if they are in a cave near you? Maybe even have rarer plagued rats spawn. If one attacks you that has the plague you contract it and occasionally take damage for a period of time. You would have to avoid villages to keep it from spreading or maybe hand deliver it to those pesky, no good pillagers! Maybe make milk/honey cure it to give them another use? Tame rats could fetch dropped items for you in a certain area and put them into your inventory/nearby chests?
Not a bad idea on the plague part, but I am not sure if Minecraft is quite ready for a disease mechanic. It would be interesting though.
I have loved the idea of contagious potion effects, and rats could be a good example of mobs that can naturally spawn with and be immune to those effects
Yes please, the cut copper texture just isn't great and really doesn't match well with the normal copper texture
Yes we need this
hey guys if you have a idea or something you would like to add please put it in the comments
I agree to add more types of the golems

Are they also related to smegal from Lord of the rings :p I'm not against the idea of new types of golems but I don't think mojang is gonna add something from a movie due to copy write issues . however wouldn't mind something like a stone soldier golem you can craft using two smooth stone blocks or regular stone , with a pumpkin head and it'll spawn a player sized golem holding a stone sword and regular shield. They'd have low health and only move when hostile mobs are near (stationary)
Des golems de lapis lazuli sont une bonne idée il enchanté négativement vos objets si vous l'attaquer et positivement si vous leur donnez un diamant (dans les deux cas tout vos objets)
Il vit dans les Lush caves (mon golem)

This would be a stone golem.

It sounds a little similar to a mob from the quark mod (I cant remember the name of it).
I actually like this idea. I like to find lost civilizations, such as monuments. I 100% like it.
There already are snowballs

Yes, but snowballs break, these won't. It could either be placed on the ground, kind of like in the April 2022 Fools update, or they would just stay in their dropped form, OR, they could be like arrows but thrown with hands
But flower is not mechanic

A dripleaf isn't mechanical either, but it can be held up by redstone signals, and beehives/beenests let out redstone signals too,

So do lecterns, armor stands, cauldrons and many others.

Plus, as I said, it could be closable by touch, like some real life plants are, and it could slowly open back up over time, just saying though, it would be nice if redstone held it open, or at least was an alternative for touching it.
Neither are dripleaves, but you can control those with redstone, and many things, for example, beehives, let OFF redstone sygnals anyway sooooooooooo
Ты конечно молодец за такую идею но по редстоуну как по мне не очень дороботай слегкааааааааа свою версию и я думаю такую небольшую реалестичность точно добавят )))

Translation for above comment

Of course, well done for such an idea, but with to the redstone, as for me, doesn't really work on my version that well buuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuut think they should definitely add such a little detail)))
This idea sounds cool! =)

dear Mojang,

this is a humble request for you to add the copper golem back. there are a few reasons for it being useful. the first reason is that it will give copper some use and there are many Redstone ideas involving the cooper golem. please add the copper golem. I would be very grateful.

thank you, 

yours sincerely,

DirectFlower65
allay is useless

Minecraft should have ways to avoid every distaster, and adding earthquakes adds nothing but a hassle and gives nothing to players unlike lightning, which is avoidable but can affect mobs, making you need it sometimes.
This is a pretty good idea, but it should be a lot more expensive.
No, a big part of the fun in minecraft is having to move mobs (especially villagers) by rail!
Maybe you could have crying obsidian instead of the soul sand and put soul sand in the center. that would have another use for crying obsidian other than just respawn anchors. just an idea.
There is no reason for this and with the amount of marketing already done by Mojang it won’t happen

I really like the concept. Very cool. The only thing I would object with is Wardens not spawning within 3 days, as that will be too overpowered given that the Deep Dark is mainly meant to be a stealth mission in order to ressurect the first night experience for late-game players. Otherwise this is so cool :)
Thet don't spawn in a 100x100 area for 3 days. The other Wardens will be fine and won't be affected
This got added in 22w16a, a disc found in only deep dark cities in pieces called 5
we need a warden music disc
This would be very cool, like a glow mushroom, and/or a Glowshroom, a mooshroom-like mob that when sheared drops glow mushrooms
It would be great to have these plants pulse light to add to the mood.

The combat snapshots still aren't finished yet. There's still plans for more(although the last one was from 2020 and Jeb said that it'd be a while) and the combat isn't finalized. We'll probably get another snapshot once 1.18 is finished or around when 1.19 is announced, then once the community is satisfied the combat will *eventually* be added into the main game. I do wish we get one soon though.
A copper variant would also be nice. In any case it is about time we get the ability to produce the chime sounds from the music discs.

Wind chimes could randomly chime certain note pitches at different elevations. Alternatively, just playing ambient sounds would be very nice.

Imagine finding a villager hermit living atop a mountain by listening for the sound of chimes!

I think this is a really cool idea! If this happened there could be some sort of falcon/hawk that nests in the cliffs. They could either be aggressive when you get too close to their nest/eggs, or they could be tamed and used to hunt mobs like rabbits.
I was about to post this same idea. I want there to be Calcite cliffs in Minecraft. I don't think that they should be super rare though...
